Description: Lemon Scented Gum is a very fast growing tree, up to 51 metres in height, from temperate and tropical north eastern Australia. It has smooth, pale, uniform or slightly mottled bark, white to coppery in summer, and a conspicuously narrow-leaved crown which smells strongly of lemons. Pear-shaped buds are borne in clusters of three, formed in the corner of leaf and stem junctions, whilst fruit (capsules) are urn-shaped. The bark is smooth for the entire height of the tree, often powdery, shedding in thin curling flakes.
Name: Lemon Scented Gum Tree
Authority: (Hook.) K. D. Hill & L. A. S. Johnson
